alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 19 at 8:54PM MDT until June 20 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry, and unstable conditions will return Tuesday with poor overnight humidity recovery. Breezy to locally windy southwest to west winds will combine with low relative humidity to create several hours of critical fire weather for portions of New Mexico. Any fires that develop will have the potential for rapid fire growth in receptive fuel beds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and Central Highlands (Zone 125). * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 20 to 25 mph with gusts to around 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
